intro: Gonzalagunia nivea, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving them a soft appearance. Gonzalagunia nivea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
